results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 02?]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: 1. A lesson in geography - shows the size of Australia in relation to Scandinavia and Europe. 2. Warburton District - located on the Great Dividing Range, Victoria, shows scenery and inhabitants. 3. The Princes Highway - from Lakes Entrance to Narooma inlet. Shows Lakes Entrance locals and holiday-makers; an Aborigine fishing with a spear; Narooma’s beautiful inlet; oyster fishing and eating. 4. Animal bandits - animals dance to the sound of birds; they form a band but their tunes are unbearable until they attend Professor Heron’s school of music.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: Wine service: a guide for professional waiters
results.creator_credit: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Produced by the Australian Wine Board, this work features the skills and knowledge required for wine waiting. A short instructional film, it aims to assist in making the right selection of wine varieties to match with food, relying on the knowledge of the restaurant staff. Get the insider knowledge from inside the waiters’ pantry: “it’s important you have a sound knowledge of your foods, and more particularly of your wines”.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Alexander Hammid and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: For Tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Norman Castle, Lilias Castle, Conzinc Riotinto of Australia and Fraser Castle
results.brief_description: Conzinc Riotinto sends geologists to Bougainville to search for minerals. The rugged mountainous jungle country, heat and humidity makes it an arduous task. They establish a drilling site where much sampling, testing and drilling of the area is carried out to evaluate the location.

results.title: Nimmo St
results.brief_description: This film is short drama with a musical soundtrack and no dialogue set around Nimmo Street in Middle Park, Melbourne. A young man meets a woman arriving on a ‘Red Rattler’ train and walks her home. On the way, they are accosted by two thugs but manage to avoid conflict. When the young woman reaches her home and doesn’t invite the man in, he leaves and takes out his frustration on the thugs when he encounters them again in the street. A simple, beautifully shot, low budget film capturing Melbourne’s inner suburban street life.
